alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Slow moving showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of Forsyth, northeastern Davidson, northwestern Randolph and western Guilford Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow moving showers and storms over the Triad. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rain and minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Kernersville, Clemmons, Lewisville, Archdale and Trinity. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
